description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fs8c8","text":"PURPOSE: to define the standard operating procedure for collecting isolate metadata using BioNumerics for submission of food/environmental isolates to NCBI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9i73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hq4f","text":"SCOPE: to provide a standardized procedure to collect isolate metadata using BioNumerics for submission of food/environmental isolates to NCBI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"986bq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g47r","text":"RESPONSIBILITIES- SOP Responsible Officials: Ruth Timme, Maria Balkey","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4fj3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5iju1","text":"The GenomeTrakr Network Management will be responsible to monitor GenomeTrakr submissions processed through Bionumerics and ensure that all GT labs are familiar with the mandatory metadata fields required for submission of GenomeTrakr sequencing records to NCBI. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fu1v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"889k4","text":"V3:  Dropdown menus from controlled vocabulary added to the ncbi_update submission sheet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ,NCBI submission, BioNumerics, biosample, SRA, metadata, bioproject

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"990ce","text":"Metadata SampleSheet preparation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"222n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5voin","text":"Before uploading your sequencing run or linking NCBI sequencing records at the BioNumerics platform make sure to fill out the metadata spreadsheet form.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fnah5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4tvbj","text":"Please download the template and guidelines included in the file 'GT_BioNumerics_spreadsheet_v2.xlsx'.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8emgv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"47n2h","text":"Create the fields NCBI_bioproject, Attribute_package, Organism_name, NCBI_LabID, SourceCountryState, Latitude_longitude,  Reference_material, Culture_collection or Description if they are not in the BioNumerics interface and are needed to process the metadata for your isolates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fsjat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"92sqt","text":"Once you have filled out the template information, save the template sheet as .csv and import the metadata to BioNumerics. {"blocks":[{"key":"f65it","text":" BioProject and Organization:  GenomeTrakr labs by submitting independently become owners of their data and are responsible for managing individual bioprojects for each sequenced organism. {"blocks":[{"key":"9jgbf","text":"Laboratories will be submitting to specific bioprojects for lab/organisms.  Find the organism/lab specific bioproject under each of the GenomeTrakr umbrella bioprojects included at https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/593772","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":181,"length":46}],"data":[]},{"key":"djh41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6vo2e","text":"Make sure to submit to your lab bioproject.  Please don't submit to umbrella bioprojects. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D2EF0659A77D11EBA91D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/593772"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44ia9","text":"BioSample:  Metadata associate to the isolate might require the creation of new fields in BioNumerics. The term 'field content ' denotes that the template value e.g. Organism name is mapping to the field in BioNumerics e.g. Organism_name.  The template values might map to default values e.g. Pathogen: environmental/food/other; version 1.0.    Make sure to include the metadata associated to the isolates in the mandatory fields such as:  Submitter Provided Unique ID, BioSample accession (output), Organism name, Title, Attribute package, Strain name and Isolate name alias.   Isolate name alias is a mandatory field for GenomeTrakr submissions.  Provide serovar when available. {"blocks":[{"key":"534v1","text":"BioSample:   Make sure to include the metadata associated to the isolates in the mandatory fields such as:  Collected by, Collection / Isolate date, Collection / Isolate date format, Title, Geographical origin and Isolate source.   Isolate name alias is a mandatory field for GenomeTrakr submissions.  Provide Geographical coordinates when available.  Host or host disease are provided only for isolates obtained from human, indicate "missing" for isolates from food or environmental sources.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"de36u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6sv0i","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"761ao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dt1ub","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"67ic4","text":"          Name of   Field in BioNumerics Template  Description    Name of Field in BioNumerics   DataBase  Example of metadata value    Collected by  Full name of laboratory that   collected the sample or has taken over curation of the isolate.    NCBI_LabID (field content)    NY Department of Agriculture and Markets    Collection date  Date on which the sample was   collected. Populate using ISO 8601 standard: “YYYY-mm-dd”, “YYYY-mm” or   “YYYY” (e.g., 1990–10–30, 1990–10, or 1990).        Including the month or month/day of collection is extremely valuble for   accessing seasonality in the database.  IsolateDate (field content)       2020    Geographical location  Country and State for sample   collection    SourceCountryState (field    content)       USA:NY    Geographical coordinates  latitude and longitude for site   of collection.  Missing if it is not   provided  <Missing>  missing    Isolation source  Detailed description for sample   product or environmental source   SourceSite (field content)       cheese    Host  Only provided for human   isolates     <Missing>  missing    Host disease  Only provided for human   isolates    <Missing>  missing  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1173}],"data":[]},{"key":"ds266","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4kock","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BDC2E580FC4D11EBA3A743B1CE53D28C","height":526,"id":190323,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":44,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"937ib","text":"Fig 2.   collected. ","IsolateDate (field content)     ","2020"],["Geographical location","Country and State for sample
  collection  ","SourceCountryState (field 
  content)     ","USA:NY"],["Geographical coordinates","latitude and longitude for site
  of collection.  Missing if it is not
  provided","<Missing>","missing"],["Isolation source","Detailed description for sample
  product or environmental source ","SourceSite (field content)     ","cheese"],["Host","Only provided for human
  isolates   ","<Missing>","missing"],["Host disease","Only provided for human
  isolates  ","<Missing>","missing"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
